frameDefinitions: This frame deals with a Healer treating and curing an Affliction (the injuries, disease, or pain) of the Patient, sometimes also mentioning the use of a particular Treatment or Medication.

These words describe the recovery or healing of a Patient from an Affliction without reference to the influence of any Treatment or Healer (see the Cure frame).  '' 'My injuries had not yet completely healed.'
An Agent resolves an outstanding Problem by finding its solution, explanation, answer, etc.
An Agent has done or omitted to do an Act or is responsible for the obtaining of a State_of_affairs, which a Judge deems to constitute a violation of an obligation or a moral guideline.
An Agent works on a Project so that it reaches a more advanced and desirable state.
frameExamples: Isis then <t>cured</t> Re by reciting a spell.
My injuries had not yet completely <t>healed</t>.
As it turns out, putting all of my eggs in one basket completely <t>solved</t> all of my problems.
Kim failed to fully <t>justify</t> his decision.
listRoleDefinitions: The  Healer, anyone who treats or cures the Patient, occurs as the External Argument of verbs:

This   is the sufferer of the injury, disease or pain and can occur as an NP Object in this frame. However, Patient may not be expressed as a separate Frame Element but frequently occurs as the possessor of the Affliction, an example of  role Conflation:  (See section on Conflation.)
The Frame Element Affliction is generally the NP Object of a verb, frequently incorporating the Patient as a possessor, as described above:
The role Treatment is used for treatments and means, distinguished by separate FEs in FN-1.
The injested, applied, injected, etc. substance designed to cure the Patient.
The <fen>Body_part</fen> is the specific area of the <fen>Patient</fen>'s body which is treated.
When the event occurs.
Where the event takes place.
The    Patient may either be expressed as the External Argument or, as in Health.Cure, may occur as the possessor of the Affliction (an example of role conflation):
This role is the injury, pain or disease experienced by the Patient.  Affliction occurs either as an External Argument of verbs or as a PP Complement of nouns or verbs:
Where Body Part is expressed as a separate constituent (rather than in phrases such as <ment>the wound on Pat's arm</ment>), it occurs as an External Argument:
The time at which the recovery takes place.
The location where the recovery takes place.
The <fen>Agent</fen> finds the solution or explanation to the outstanding mystery or <fen>Problem</fen>.
The <fen>Problem</fen> is the predicament or mystery that is resolved.
The <fen>Cause</fen> is the non-Agentive event or state of affairs that brings about the resolution of the <fen>Problem</fen>.
This role indicates the <fen>Time</fen> at which the <fen>Problem</fen> is resolved.
This role indicates the location at which the <fen>Problem</fen> is resolved.
The person or organization that  is held responsible for a prior <fen>Act</fen> or for a <fen>State_of_affairs</fen>.
An action  for which the <fen>Agent</fen> is held responsible, frequently one that the <fen>Agent</fen> has taken themself.
A <fen>State_of_affairs</fen> that the Agent is held responsible for.
The <fen>Time</fen> of the justifying event.
The object or idea that undergoes change due to the efforts of the <fen>Agent</fen>.
The individual that brings about the development of the <fen>Project</fen>.
The time at which the progress occurs.
The location at which the the <fen>Project</fen> progresses.
listRoleExamples: If <fex>we</fex> have not been able to resolve a problem to your satisfaction, please email us.
Likewise, once the students worked through <fex>the problem</fex> and obtained their results, their next assignment would be to publish these to the web.
First, <fex>the Tripartite Agreement of 1979</fex> actually solved the only significant friction between the two countries.
A group of international scientists solved the fundamental particle hierarchy question <fex>at an underground accelerator</fex>.
<fex>Smithers</fex> defended his decision by insisting that he had used his best judgment
Kim failed  to fully justify <fex>his decision</fex>.
The lawyers tried  to justify <fex>enormous punitive damages being paid to victims on a first-past-the-post system</fex> .
